name: Island Maui Haze
description: Island Maui Haze is a 75/25 sativa-dominant strain with effects that can creep up on you. These dense, forest green buds may not initially attract you based on its strong, ammonia smell; however, this crystal-covered strain is praised for its uplifting, energetic effects that can relieve pain and other symptoms without bringing you down into a lazy state.
descriptionPlain: Island Maui Haze is a 75/25 sativa-dominant strain with effects that can creep up on you. These dense, forest green buds may not initially attract you based on its strong, ammonia smell; however, this crystal-covered strain is praised for its uplifting, energetic effects that can relieve pain and other symptoms without bringing you down into a lazy state.

highlightedReviews.text: Hits you aside the head first. Bewilderingly gobbled up ability to think straight but there remains a subtle sharpness that not only adds much needed contrast but really shows how staggeringly consuming the high gradually becomes. Like slow motion ego loss, haha. Vision is a bit muddy and out of focus. Very physical, though - sense of touch is extra stimulating. Music is real nice...captivating. It encompasses you down to an emotional, psychedelic level. The short attention span makes listening persistently surprising. Body relaxation feels like a post-massage high. Like someone just stopped rubbing my shoulders. Strong, stable sense of euphoria and self-assuredness. Noticeable sativa twinge has remained pretty consistent across my chest. It adds some intensity. Overall, though, the mental state feels quite nice and positive, with a comfortable resignedness. A strong high with character, not without its challenges, but rewarding in a worthwhile way, I think. Good for mood and sense of place. Plays up emotional sensitivity. Road trips...scenic hikes...rainy day music...

*quite* potent, mesmerizing sativa. Not for the faint of heart but produces unbelievably amazing effects.

I bought something at an Oregon dispensary marketed under the name 'Island,' but was described as essentially the same cross as what is on here so I assume it must be fairly close. You don't need to smoke too much of this to get blasted - my normal 'dose' for MJ of one large hand pipe bowl was enough to put me in the stratosphere. 

It hits you hard head on and gave me a nice mix of euphoria, pleasant body buzz, sociality and intense creativity, glued together by an occasionally overpowering intoxication. Terrible attention span but still capacity to focus. Can produce a bit of anxiety, but it's totally manageable. 

~~However~~ I must say that as a musician, this shit gives me the most ridiculous creative urge ever. Like I can't pull myself away from the piano, and just vibe with the music so hard. I really think artistic types should all try it.

articles.title: New Strains Alert: Firewalker OG, Killer Grape, Island Maui Haze, Mt. Cook, and More
articles.author: Bailey Rahn
articles.text:
It might be Christmas, but that doesn't mean the new strains will stop rolling in! If you're already thinking ahead to your next dispensary run, check to see if any of these strains are available near you by clicking the links below. Happy holidays!
 
   1. Blue Thai

Blue Thai by Dinafem Seeds is a hybrid strain from the Netherlands that crosses Blueberry and Thai Skunk. This fruity, mold-resistant strain offers the best results when grown outdoors, but also performs well indoors and finishes flowering after 8 weeks.

Click here for a full list of locations currently carrying Blue Thai
 
   2. Cuvee

A collaboration from TGA Genetics and Aficionado seeds, Cuvee was created crossing Space Queen and the clone-only Pinot Noir. This hybrid plant will hit you fast with a relaxing body high while you taste sweet cherries and chocolate. Rich flavor paired with copious amounts of resin makes Cuvee a great strain for making cannabis concentrates.

Click here for a full list of locations currently carrying Cuvee
 
   3. Firewalker OG

Firewalker OG is a sativa-dominant cross between Skywalker and Fire OG that is spicy with hints of flowers and hash. This strain is ideal for daytime use as you will feel full of energy and ready to take on the day. It also has many medicinal qualities, making it potentially beneficial for patients who are suffering from depression, muscle spasms, mood disorders, and anorexia.

Click here for a full list of locations currently carrying Firewalker OG
 
   4. Killer Grape

A cross between Killer Queen and Querkle, Killer Grape is a heavy-handed 50/50 hybrid strain that deals a stupefying blast of cerebral euphoria and deeply relaxing effects. Lavender and purple hues tinge leaves and buds underneath a dusty coat of snow-white resin. This strain from NorStar Genetics gets its name from the sour grape aroma its buds carry, which is accented by spicy, hashy undertones.

Click here for a full list of locations currently carrying Killer Grape
 
   5. Mt. Cook

Named after the highest peak in New Zealand, Mt. Cook by Kiwiseeds is a former Cannabis Cup champion. After selecting their top Afghani female, a special Northern Lights and Hash Plant male was used to pollinate and create this potent indica. Known to be powerful and sedative, this is a great strain to relax and catch some sleep with.

 
   6. Island Maui Haze

Island Maui Haze is a 75/25 sativa-dominant strain with effects that can creep up on you. These dense, forest green buds may not initially attract you based on its strong, ammonia smell; however, this crystal-covered strain is praised for its uplifting, energetic effects that can relieve pain and other symptoms without bringing you down into a lazy state.

Click here for a full list of locations currently carrying Island Maui Haze
 
   7. Leda Uno

A Cannabis Cup finalist in the sativa category, Leda Uno will undoubtedly raise your spirits. The team at KC Brains took its KC 33 crossed with a Brazilian female landrace and crossed it once more with its KC 606 and Leda hybrid. The result is a smooth lemony hybrid with beautiful chunky, light green buds. Best when grown in soil, this plant can shoot to 10 feet outdoors and produces considerable yields.

 
Browse through our other new strains that were recently added to the Leafly Explorer, or check out last week's newest additions!
